text: The House of Representatives (, Pyithu Hluttaw) is the lower house of the Pyidaungsu Hluttaw, the bicameral legislature of Myanmar (Burma). It is made up of 440 members, of which 330 are directly elected through the first-past- the-post system in each townships and 110 are appointed by the Myanmar Armed Forces. As of 8 November 2015, 90% of the members are men (389 members) and 10% women (44 members). ==References== Category:Politics of Myanmar Myanmar
title: Pyithu Hluttaw
